chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.```", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
X: Type

Goal:
discrete X -> discrete (list X)

Premises:
Inductive list (A : Type) : Type := nil : list A | cons : A -> list A -> list A Arguments list _%type_scope Arguments nil {A}%type_scope Arguments cons {A}%type_scope a l%list_scope : rename
discrete = fun X : Type => decidable (fun '(x, y) => x = y) : Type -> Prop Arguments discrete _%type_scope
discrete_prod : forall X Y : Type, discrete X -> discrete Y -> discrete (X * Y)
discrete_sum : forall X Y : Type, discrete X -> discrete Y -> discrete (X + Y)
discrete_option : forall X : Type, discrete X -> discrete (option X)
discrete_bool = let H : forall X : Type, inhabited (eq_dec X) -> discrete X := fun X : Type => match discrete_iff X with | conj _ x0 => x0 end in H bool (inhabits bool_eq_dec) : discrete bool
discrete_nat = let H : forall X : Type, inhabited (eq_dec X) -> discrete X := fun X : Type => match discrete_iff X with | conj _ x0 => x0 end in H nat (inhabits nat_eq_dec) : discrete nat
discrete_nat_nat = let H : forall X : Type, inhabited (eq_dec X) -> discrete X := fun X : Type => match discrete_iff X with | conj _ x0 => x0 end in H (nat * nat)%type (inhabits (prod_eq_dec nat_eq_dec nat_eq_dec)) : discrete (nat * nat)
discrete_iff : forall X : Type, discrete X < -> inhabited (eq_dec X)
dec = fun X : Prop => {X} + {~ X} : Prop -> Type Arguments dec _%type_scope
sum_eq_dec : forall X Y : Type, eq_dec X -> eq_dec Y -> eq_dec X + Y
prod_eq_dec : forall X Y : Type, eq_dec X -> eq_dec Y -> eq_dec X * Y
option_eq_dec : forall X : Type, eq_dec X -> eq_dec option X
Tauto.TFormula = fun Term Annot TX AF : Type => Tauto.GFormula : Type -> Type -> Type -> Type -> Type Arguments Tauto.TFormula (_ _ _ _)%type_scope
List.concat : forall A : Type, list (list A) -> list A
decidable = fun (X : Type) (P : X -> Prop) => exists f : X -> bool, decider f P : forall X : Type, (X -> Prop) -> Prop Arguments decidable {X}%type_scope _%function_scope
Tauto.cnf_checker : forall Term' Annot Witness : Type, (list (Term' * Annot) -> Witness -> bool) -> Tauto.cnf Term' Annot -> list Witness -> bool
Tauto.cnf = fun Term' Annot : Type => list (Tauto.clause Term' Annot) : Type -> Type -> Type Arguments Tauto.cnf (_ _)%type_scope
Tauto.clause = fun Term' Annot : Type => list (Term' * Annot) : Type -> Type -> Type Arguments Tauto.clause (_ _)%type_scope
RingMicromega.NFormula = fun C : Type => (RingMicromega.PolC C * RingMicromega.Op1)%type : Type -> Type Arguments RingMicromega.NFormula _%type_scope
Tauto.tauto_checker : forall Term Term' Annot : Type, (Term' -> bool) -> (Term' -> Term' -> option Term') -> (Term -> Annot -> Tauto.cnf Term' Annot) -> (Term -> Annot -> Tauto.cnf Term' Annot) -> forall Witness : Type, (list (Term' * Annot) -> Witness -> bool) -> Tauto.GFormula -> list Witness -> bool
List.concat_filter_map : forall (A : Type) (f : A -> bool) (l : list (list A)), List.concat (List.map (List.filter f) l) = List.filter f (List.concat l)
List.map_ext_in_iff : List.map ?f ?l = List.map ?g ?l < -> (forall a : ?A, List.In a ?l -> ?f a = ?g a) where ?A : [X : Type |- Type] ?B : [X : Type |- Type] ?f : [X : Type |- ?A -> ?B] ?g : [X : Type |- ?A -> ?B] ?l : [X : Type |- list ?A]
decidable_iff : forall (X : Type) (p : X -> Prop), decidable p < -> inhabited (forall x : X, dec (p x))
Inductive GFormula (TA TX AA AF : Type) : Type := TT : Tauto.GFormula | FF : Tauto.GFormula | X : TX -> Tauto.GFormula | A : TA -> AA -> Tauto.GFormula | Cj : Tauto.GFormula -> Tauto.GFormula -> Tauto.GFormula | D : Tauto.GFormula -> Tauto.GFormula -> Tauto.GFormula | N : Tauto.GFormula -> Tauto.GFormula | I : Tauto.GFormula -> option AF ->...-> Tauto.GFormula Arguments Tauto.GFormula {TA TX AA AF}%type_scope Arguments Tauto.TT {TA TX AA AF}%type_scope Arguments Tauto.FF {TA TX AA AF}%type_scope Arguments Tauto.X {TA TX AA AF}%type_scope Arguments Tauto.A {TA TX AA AF}%type_scope Arguments Tauto.Cj {TA TX AA AF}%type_scope Arguments Tauto.D {TA TX AA AF}%type_scope Arguments Tauto.N {TA TX AA AF}%type_scope Arguments Tauto.I {TA TX AA AF}%type_scope
Inductive prod (A B : Type) : Type := pair : A -> B -> A * B Arguments prod (_ _)%type_scope Arguments pair {A B}%type_scope
Inductive Pol (C : Type) : Type := Pc : C -> Ring_polynom.Pol C | Pinj : BinNums.positive -> Ring_polynom.Pol C -> Ring_polynom.Pol C | PX : Ring_polynom.Pol C -> BinNums.positive -> Ring_polynom.Pol C -> Ring_polynom.Pol C Arguments Ring_polynom.Pol _%type_scope Arguments Ring_polynom.Pc [C]%type_scope Arguments Ring_polynom.Pinj [C]%type_scope _%positive_scope Arguments Ring_polynom.PX [C]%type_scope _ _%positive_scope
Inductive list (A : Type) : Type := nil : list A | cons : A -> list A -> list A Arguments list _%type_scope Arguments nil {A}%type_scope Arguments cons {A}%type_scope a l%list_scope : rename
List.in_concat : forall (A : Type) (l : list (list A)) (y : A), List.In y (List.concat l) < -> (exists x : list A, List.In x l /\ List.In y x)
Inductive sig (A : Type) (P : A -> Prop) : Type := exist : forall x : A, P x -> {x : A | P x} Arguments sig [A]%type_scope _%type_scope Arguments exist [A]%type_scope _%function_scope
Inductive sigT (A : Type) (P : A -> Type) : Type := existT : forall x : A, P x -> {x : A & P x} Arguments sigT [A]%type_scope _%type_scope Arguments existT [A]%type_scope _%function_scope
Inductive t (A : Type) : nat -> Type := nil : VectorDef.t A 0 | cons : A -> forall n : nat, VectorDef.t A n -> VectorDef.t A (S n) Arguments VectorDef.t _%type_scope _%nat_scope Arguments VectorDef.nil _%type_scope Arguments VectorDef.cons _%type_scope _ _%nat_scope
